meanings.sent1: I accidentally miscataloged the books by putting them in the wrong order.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to miscatalog the items in the library, or it will be hard to find them later.
meanings.sent3: Oops! I miscataloged the DVDs as books, and now I can't find my favorite movie.
meanings.sent4: Her memory miscataloged the events of that day, making her recall the wrong details.
meanings.sent5: The detective's mistake to miscatalog the evidence led to the wrong suspect being arrested.

meanings.sent1: The miscatalog in the system caused confusion among the staff.
meanings.sent2: We need to fix the miscatalog in the inventory to avoid any mistakes in the future.
meanings.sent3: The miscatalog in the museum made visitors think the painting was from a different artist.
meanings.sent4: The miscatalog of products led to delays in shipping orders to customers.
meanings.sent5: The student's miscatalog of the library books made it challenging to return them on time.
